itinerary.mapNote: Below Fitz Roy massif. Río Blanco valley. 650m.
Pre-dawn hike to Laguna de los Tres 1170m. Return to camp. 650m.
Laguna Torre and Cerro Torre view. Return to Chaltén. 400m.

waypoints.name: Cerro Fitz Roy
waypoints.note: 'El Chaltén' to locals. Iconic granite spire. Never easy to see — clouds 80% of time.

waypoints.name: Laguna de los Tres
waypoints.note: Closest lake to Fitz Roy. Pre-dawn hike for clear reflections.

waypoints.name: Cerro Torre
waypoints.note: Arguably the world's most difficult rock climb. Ice mushroom summit.

waypoints.name: Laguna Torre
waypoints.note: Glacier and Cerro Torre reflections. Detached iceberg sometimes.

waypoints.name: Piedras Blancas Glacier
waypoints.note: Active glacier above Laguna de los Tres approach trail.

waypoints.name: El Chaltén Village
waypoints.note: Argentina's trekking capital. Founded 1985. Gateway to Los Glaciares.
